pages.title: MI Cape Town vs Joburg Super Kings, 15th Match
pages.description:
The SA20 2025-26 season moves forward, as MI Cape Town (MICT) are all set to host the Joburg Super Kings (JSK) in the Match No. 15 on Tuesday, January 6 at the Newlands in Cape Town. 

The alarm bells are ringing, and MI Cape Town are on the brink of elimination already from the ongoing season. The franchise has failed to register a single win so far out of the five matches they have featured in. Their previous game saw them fail to post even 100 runs on the board, which was later chased down by the Paarl Royals with rather ease. They are in a dire need to pick up a win now.


The Joburg Super Kings, on the other hand, are the table toppers with an absolute domination on the points table. The Faf du Plessis-led side is yet to lose a single match this match, with 15 points to their tally after four matches. They already have a hat-trick of wins, but won't mind making it a double hat-trick and bolster their top spot on the table. High on confidence, the Super Kings will be eyeing to beat the hosts.

Squads:
Joburg Super Kings Squad: Matthew De Villiers, Faf du Plessis(c), Rilee Rossouw, Wiaan Mulder, Shubham Ranjane, Donovan Ferreira(w), Dian Forrester, Prenelan Subrayen, Duan Jansen, Akeal Hosein, Richard Gleeson, Rivaldo Moonsamy, Nandre Burger, Steve Stolk, Janco Smit, Neil Timmers, Jarren Bacher, Daniel Worrall, Reece Topley, Imran Tahir, James Vince

pages.title: CricTv - Australia Vs England, Day 4, Live Streaming
pages.description: Ashes Day 4 Between England And Australia Catch Live Only On Cric Tv

seo.meta_description: Watch All Match Live On Cricket Tv For Free.Without Any Charges

paragraphs: Australia had a great day with the bat yesterday as they moved themselves into a position of strength. England were sloppy in the field especially early in the day as they dropped Travis Head a number of times. Head struck 163 before getting dismissed. Smith carried on the good work as he batted with a lot of composure and proactiveness. He mixed caution with aggression to perfection and struck a delightful century to not only help his side move into the lead but also push home the advantage. Webster is giving him good company as well. The surface has already started to play some tricks with variable bounce troubling the batters on certain occasions. England have a steep task in front of them. They would want to restrict the damage as much as they can and bowl Australia out quickly this morning. If they fail to do so, they will be pushed on the back foot further. Batting will be a tricky proposition going ahead on Day 4 and Day 5. Another absorbing day of Test cricket awaits us...

seo.meta_title: Perth Scorches Vs Melbourne Renegade's Live Streaming
seo.meta_description: Watch Perth Scorchers vs Melbourne Renegades live streaming online. Get match time, squads, live updates and HD streaming on CricTV.

paragraphs:
Match Details
Match: Perth Scorchers vs Melbourne Renegades, 26th Match
Tournament: Big Bash League 2026
Date: 7 January 2026
Venue: Perth Stadium
Time: Night Match

Perth Stadium tends to reward pace, bounce, and disciplined hitting, a venue tailor-made for competitive cricket under lights.

Venue Insight: Perth Stadium
Fast and lively surfaces are usually provided in . The mean number of runs in the first innings is normally 160 to 175. Seamers enjoy the advantage of bounce and carry early, due to which top-order batters face difficulties. 

Spinners come into play later in the innings as batters are forced to take risks. First-bat teams are comfortable establishing a total, but these partnerships are disciplined in a pursuit to keep the game alive until the very end.

Batters to Watch

Perth Scorchers

Ashton Turner  
Turner's recent form - 263 runs at an average of 43.83 and a 180 strike rate - shows why he is invaluable. Calm under pressure, he rebuilds when needed and accelerates with authority.

Aaron Hardie  
With 260 runs at a brisk strike rate, Hardie anchors innings while providing power late. His ability to switch gears makes him central to the Scorchers batting blueprint.

Melbourne Renegades

Tim Seifert  
Seifert's 243 runs at a 141 strike rate underline his role as a fast start specialist. If he settles early, the Renegades gain immediate momentum.

Josh Brown  
Explosive and fearless, Brown's 216 runs at over 160 strike rate show his match winning potential. His duel against the Scorchers quicks could shift the contest.

Squads

Perth Scorchers:
Ashton Turner (c), Ashton Agar, Finn Allen, Mahli Beardman, Cooper Connolly, Brody Couch, Joel Curtis, Laurie Evans, Sam Fanning, Aaron Hardie, Nick Hobson, Josh Inglis, Bryce Jackson, Matthew Kelly, Mitchell Marsh, Lance Morris, Joel Paris, David Payne, Jhye Richardson, Corey Rocchiccioli

Melbourne Renegades:
Will Sutherland (c), Jason Behrendorff, Josh Brown, Harry Dixon, Brendan Doggett, Sam Elliott, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Hassan Khan, Caleb Jewell, Nathan Lyon, Mohammad Rizwan, Fergus O'Neill, Oliver Peake, Tom Rogers, William Salzmann, Gurinder Sandhu, Tim Seifert, Matthew Spoors, Callum Stow, Andrew Tye, Adam Zampa

Match Prediction
Slight Advantage: Perth Scorchers

Home conditions, depth in batting, and a balanced attack give the Scorchers a narrow edge. However, one explosive innings from Seifert or a decisive spell from Sandhu could completely rewrite the script.

Final Word
The Perth Scorchers vs Melbourne Renegades encounter holds major importance in the tournament. For the Scorchers, it is about consolidating dominance and building a winning rhythm heading deeper into the competition. For the Renegades, it represents resilience and a chance to prove they can still shape the season narrative.

Expect strategy, tension, and decisive key battles under the Perth lights, where one bold partnership or game changing bowling spell may decide everything.
